title: Watch: Take a Video Tour of Various Picturehouse Cinemas in the UK
description: "Planning an exciting event in North London? Look no further than Picturehouse's five-screen cinema in Crouch End." üìΩ One of the best cinema chains in the UK is called Picturehouse - based mainly in/around London, they also have cinemas in a few other cities as well. They're one of the best in terms of quality and theatrical experience (I recommend going to the Picturehouse Central in Soho - one of my favorite theaters in the world). The official Picturehouse YouTube posted a series of 5 video tours inside of 5 of their cinemas: the Regal Picturehouse at Henley, City Screen York, Epsom Square, Crouch End, & Ealing Picturehouse. The videos were created to promote the venues for use in events & meetings. They want to get more people not in cinema to rent them. Or you can rent one of the screens and throw a private movie night for your friends & family. üçø Because I'm still a movie theater nerd, and FS has always been about hyping up the theatrical experience, I'm featuring all the videos below anyway. Also because it's fun to get an full inside look at many different theaters ‚Äì I love seeing what each screen [‚Ä¶]
author: Alex Billington
excerpt: "Planning an exciting event in North London? They're one of the best in terms of quality
text: WORTH WATCHING by July 14, 2025Source: YouTube "Planning an exciting event in North London? Look no further than Picturehouse's five-screen cinema in Crouch End." üìΩ One of the best cinema chains in the UK is called Picturehouse - based mainly in/around London, they also have cinemas in a few other cities as well. They're one of the best in terms of quality and theatrical experience (I recommend going to the Picturehouse Central in Soho - one of my favorite theaters in the world). The official Picturehouse YouTube posted a series of 5 video tours inside of 5 of their cinemas: the Regal Picturehouse at Henley, City Screen York, Epsom Square, Crouch End, & Ealing Picturehouse. The videos were created to promote the venues for use in events & meetings. They want to get more people not in cinema to rent them. Or you can rent one of the screens and throw a private movie night for your friends & family. üçø Because I'm still a movie theater nerd, and FS has always been about hyping up the theatrical experience, I'm featuring all the videos below anyway. Also because it's fun to get an full inside look at many different theaters ‚Äì I love seeing what each screen looks like, what color the seats are, how they're designed, how big the screen is, etc. I've never been to these ‚Äì but now I'd like to go watch a movie at any/all of them. All videos are from the Picturehouse YT channel here. Here's the intro for each: "The Regal Picturehouse at Henley is a perfect choice locally as an event venue for hire. The three auditoria are perfectly suited to hosting a wide range of events. With digital screens, comfortable seating and a perfect view, every time!" "City Screen York is an exciting landmark in the city centre which is just a short walk from York Railway Station. The award-winning building with its panoramic river views is a unique and memorable setting for private hires and conferences." "We are excited to offer a variety of screens in our beautiful, brand new cinema in the heart of Epsom Square, suitable for hosting a range of events." "Crouch End - Our five auditoria, with capacity for up to 168 guests, are perfect for theatre-style meetings, presentations, AGMs & conferences. Add to this our breakout spaces for smaller numbers, the upstairs bar area for cocktails and canap√©s, and the Private Dining Room for an intimate dining experience..." "With eight screens and lovely bar & restaurant space, Ealing Picturehouse is a perfect spot to host a range of events." Or you can just go watch movies at ANY Picturehouse cinema and/or all of their other locations around London and the UK. Find more posts in: Feat, To Watch prev next
html:
WORTH WATCHING

by
July 14, 2025
Source: YouTube

"Planning an exciting event in North London? Look no further than Picturehouse's five-screen cinema in Crouch End." üìΩ One of the best cinema chains in the UK is called Picturehouse - based mainly in/around London, they also have cinemas in a few other cities as well. They're one of the best in terms of quality and theatrical experience (I recommend going to the Picturehouse Central in Soho - one of my favorite theaters in the world). The official Picturehouse YouTube posted a series of 5 video tours inside of 5 of their cinemas: the Regal Picturehouse at Henley, City Screen York, Epsom Square, Crouch End, & Ealing Picturehouse. The videos were created to promote the venues for use in events & meetings. They want to get more people not in cinema to rent them. Or you can rent one of the screens and throw a private movie night for your friends & family. üçø Because I'm still a movie theater nerd, and FS has always been about hyping up the theatrical experience, I'm featuring all the videos below anyway. Also because it's fun to get an full inside look at many different theaters ‚Äì I love seeing what each screen looks like, what color the seats are, how they're designed, how big the screen is, etc. I've never been to these ‚Äì but now I'd like to go watch a movie at any/all of them.

All videos are from the Picturehouse YT channel here. Here's the intro for each: "The Regal Picturehouse at Henley is a perfect choice locally as an event venue for hire. The three auditoria are perfectly suited to hosting a wide range of events. With digital screens, comfortable seating and a perfect view, every time!" "City Screen York is an exciting landmark in the city centre which is just a short walk from York Railway Station. The award-winning building with its panoramic river views is a unique and memorable setting for private hires and conferences." "We are excited to offer a variety of screens in our beautiful, brand new cinema in the heart of Epsom Square, suitable for hosting a range of events." "Crouch End - Our five auditoria, with capacity for up to 168 guests, are perfect for theatre-style meetings, presentations, AGMs & conferences. Add to this our breakout spaces for smaller numbers, the upstairs bar area for cocktails and canap√©s, and the Private Dining Room for an intimate dining experience..." "With eight screens and lovely bar & restaurant space, Ealing Picturehouse is a perfect spot to host a range of events." Or you can just go watch movies at ANY Picturehouse cinema and/or all of their other locations around London and the UK.

Find more posts in: Feat, To Watch
